title: Common Phrasal Verbs
summary: Essential phrasal verbs frequently used in daily life, with definitions and example sentences.

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: In this Pre-intermediate Vocabulary Lesson about Common Phrasal Verbs, you will learn essential phrasal verbs that we often use in our daily lives. Check the following pictures and look at the definitions and sentence examples below.

sections.heading: Phrasal Verbs
sections.content: Common phrasal verbs with their meanings and usage examples.

examples.definition: to place clothes or make-up on your body
examples.example: Before going outside, I put on my boots.

examples.definition: to remove something you're wearing
examples.example: I was hot, so I took off my jacket.

examples.definition: to activate a device or equipment
examples.example: I turned on the radio so I could listen to the news.

examples.definition: to deactivate a device or equipment
examples.example: Please turn off the heating when you leave the house.

examples.definition: when a machine stops working
examples.example: My car broke down while I was driving to work.

examples.definition: to end a romantic relationship
examples.example: Sally and Tom broke up last week.

examples.definition: to return something to its original place
examples.example: As soon as I've finished these books, I'll bring them back to the library.

examples.definition: to rise from bed or from sitting
examples.example: I usually get up early during the week.

examples.definition: to have a friendly relationship
examples.example: My cousin and I get along well, and we enjoy spending time together.

examples.definition: to return something borrowed
examples.example: If you lend me your dress, I'll give it back to you tomorrow.

examples.definition: to stop doing or having something
examples.example: I'm trying to give up chocolate because it's making me fat.

examples.definition: to continue doing something
examples.example: We went on dancing until midnight. Experts think the war will go on for a long time.

examples.definition: to spend time with someone
examples.example: Tim and I usually hang out at the park after school.

examples.definition: to take care of someone or something
examples.example: I'm looking after my little sister tonight because my parents are going out.

examples.definition: to search for something
examples.example: I'm looking for my glasses. Have you seen them?

examples.definition: to lift something from a surface
examples.example: I picked up the pencil that I had dropped on the floor.

examples.definition: to use all of something so none remains
examples.example: I had to go to the shop because we had run out of bread.

examples.definition: to remove something from its place
examples.example: Before going to bed, I took out the rubbish.

examples.definition: to discard something
examples.example: After finishing the last biscuit, I threw away the packet.

examples.definition: to exercise
examples.example: I work out at the gym twice a week.
